climbs.name: The Timanator
climbs.fa: Tim Snyder, Paul Rothfeldt, FFA Bruce Burgess

content.description: Starts right of Mohito at bolts. Crimp, layaway, and mantel past 3 bolts to a slopey stance beneath a right leaning crack. Follow the crack on hands and fingers to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, tcu's to orange, BD cams .4 to 3", optional small to large nuts.

climbs.name: Solitude
climbs.fa: Tim Snyder, Paul Rothfeldt, FFA Josh Odom

content.description: Where the trail meets the rocks, go left about 25 ft. Follow 2 bolts up and right to a large ledge. Climb dirty rock up and right to hit a steep seam with a bolt at the top of it. Careful climbing and a couple of pieces will get you to the bolt. Pass the bolt to reach a great horizontal. Climb straight up, clip another bolt and fire the deadpoint/dyno move to reach a nice stance and a spectacular belay. 100 ft, 2 bolt belay
content.protection: Tcu's to yellow camalot size. Small to medium stoppers. Small to medium offset cams useful.

climbs.name: Short but Sweet
climbs.fa: First Known Free Ascent - Bruce Burgess, Jan 2007

content.description: Beautiful right facing corner. Hands to fingers. Climb to a pine tree.  You can easily set a TR anchor high in the pine tree and rap the ropes around the tree to get down. 50 Ft
content.location: Far left upper end of the wall.

climbs.name: Orange Peel
climbs.fa: Bruce Burgess, Tim Snyder, Paul Rothfeldt FFA Richard Burnett

content.description: Shares start with lemonade. Climb up and right following a corner until you are even with the first bolt. Move left, clip a bolt and climb up into the right facing corner. Negotiate a short roof then crank up into the pumpy layback crack. Climb past a powerful section protected by two bolts and move left to a ledge. Move up and right to a small roof and then right, around a bulge to short headwall finish. Double bolt anchor. 85 ft
Right-leaning crack, face to a steep finish. Bolted anchor at top.
content.location: First route, right, from where the trail meets the rock.

content.description: Climb up the inside corner. Near the top of the corner, move up and left then step back right to a bolt. Climb slightly up and right to another bolt. Slab up and right passing a #2 and #6 BD nut placements to another bolt. Step slightly left and up to a small ledge. Move right clip a bolt, go straight over the bolt for the 5.10 finish or climb way right(much easier) and then back left to reach the 2 bolt belay. Belay is at 105 ft. Extend the belay down if lowering or top roping. Watch your ends.
content.protection: .4 to 2 inch cams for the inside corner, #2 and #6 BD stoppers, 4 bolts
content.location: This climb is not at the Solitude Wall. When you reach the short overhanging bulge on the Solitude trail, start traversing left. Wander left about 150 ft and you will hit another wall. On the far left side is an obvious 30 foot right facing inside corner. Start up at the inside corner.

climbs.name: Crystal Clear, aka  Titanium Test Pilot
climbs.fa: Paul Rothfeldt, Tim Snyder, FFA Bruce Burgess

content.description: Starts at a pine tree on a small ledge. Either stem off the pine or make a hard move off the ledge(sling pine tree long)followed by easy runout slab. Climb the slab up and right to a moss covered ledge with good gear. Crimp, highstep and mantel past 2 bolts to a stance beneath the roof and good gear. Climb the roof passing 1 bolt on amazing crystal holds to a jug, just over the lip of the roof. Clip a bolt and fire the mantel move. Easier climbing with a small gear placement will get you to a double bolt anchor. 5.11 a/b Yee-Haw! 100 ft rap back to pine tree ledge.
content.protection: tcu's to yellow,.3 to .75 camalots, great offset 1/2 mastercam in upper gear pod beneath roof.
